dcterms:creator: Alex Krizhevsky
Geoffrey Hinton
dcterms:description: CIFAR-10 contains 50,000 training images from 10 classes, each of which has a size of 32 Ã— 32. For the setting of novel class discovery, we split the samples of the first five classes (namely airplane, automobile, bird, cat and deer) as the labeled data and the remaining samples of the other five classes as the unlabeled data.
dcterms:title: CIFAR-10

dcterms:creator: Alex Krizhevsky
Geoffrey Hinton
dcterms:description: CIFAR-100 has the same number of training images and the same image size as CIFAR-10. The difference is that CIFAR-100 is captured from 100 classes. For evaluation, we regard the samples of the first 80 classes as the labeled data and the remaining samples of the other 20 classes as the unlabeled data.
dcterms:title: CIFAR-100

dcterms:creator: Jia Deng
Wei Dong
Richard Socher
Li-Jia Li
Kai Li
Li Fei-Fei
dcterms:description: ImageNet is a large-scale dataset, including 1.28 million training images from 1,000 classes. Following the study, we divide the training data into two splits that are composed of images from 882 classes and 118 classes, respectively. The split with 882 classes is regarded as the labeled data.
dcterms:title: ImageNet
